title: Computer Vision Mastery
description: Learn to build AI systems that can see and interpret visual information.

content.overview: Establish a strong foundation in computer vision principles and understand how machines can interpret visual data.

sections.title: What is Computer Vision?
sections.content: Computer vision is an interdisciplinary field that deals with how computers can be made to gain high-level understanding from digital images or videos. It seeks to automate tasks that the human visual system can do.

sections.title: Digital Image Representation
sections.content: Learn how images are represented digitally as arrays of pixels, understanding color spaces (RGB, HSV, LAB), and the mathematical foundations of image processing.

sections.title: Basic Image Operations
sections.content: Master fundamental operations like image filtering, enhancement, noise reduction, and geometric transformations that form the building blocks of computer vision.

keyPoints: Exploring different color spaces and their applications
Building intuition for visual data analysis
content.practicalExercise: Implement basic image filtering operations and compare their effects on different types of images.

content.overview: Learn to identify and extract meaningful features from images that can be used for recognition and matching.

sections.title: Edge Detection
sections.content: Understand edge detection algorithms like Sobel, Canny, and Laplacian filters. Learn how edges provide crucial structural information about objects in images.

sections.title: Corner and Interest Point Detection
sections.content: Explore algorithms like Harris corner detector and SIFT (Scale-Invariant Feature Transform) for finding distinctive points in images that can be tracked across different views.

sections.title: Feature Descriptors
sections.content: Learn about feature descriptors like SIFT, SURF, and ORB that can describe local image regions in a way that's robust to changes in lighting, scale, and rotation.

keyPoints: Understanding corner and interest point detection
Working with feature descriptors and matching
content.practicalExercise: Build a feature matching system that can find correspondences between different views of the same object.

content.overview: Dive into modern deep learning approaches for computer vision, focusing on convolutional neural networks and their applications.

sections.title: Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs)
sections.content: Understand the architecture and principles of CNNs, including convolutional layers, pooling operations, and how they extract hierarchical features from images.

sections.title: Popular CNN Architectures
sections.content: Explore landmark architectures like LeNet, AlexNet, VGG, ResNet, and modern networks like EfficientNet, understanding their innovations and use cases.

sections.title: Transfer Learning
sections.content: Learn how to leverage pre-trained models for new tasks, understanding fine-tuning strategies and when to freeze or train different layers.

keyPoints: Optimizing models for different vision tasks
content.practicalExercise: Fine-tune a pre-trained CNN for a custom image classification task and compare different architectures.

content.overview: Master advanced techniques for detecting and recognizing objects in images and videos.

sections.title: Object Detection Fundamentals
sections.content: Understand the difference between image classification, object detection, and segmentation. Learn about bounding boxes, intersection over union (IoU), and evaluation metrics.

sections.title: YOLO and Single-Shot Detectors
sections.content: Explore YOLO (You Only Look Once) architecture and other single-shot detectors that can detect objects in real-time with high accuracy.

sections.title: Two-Stage Detectors
sections.content: Learn about R-CNN, Fast R-CNN, and Faster R-CNN architectures that use region proposals for more accurate object detection.

keyPoints: Optimizing for speed vs accuracy tradeoffs
content.practicalExercise: Implement a real-time object detection system using YOLO and test it on video streams.

content.overview: Learn advanced techniques for pixel-level understanding of images through segmentation methods.

sections.title: Semantic Segmentation
sections.content: Understand semantic segmentation where each pixel is classified into a category. Learn about FCN (Fully Convolutional Networks) and U-Net architectures.

sections.title: Instance Segmentation
sections.content: Explore instance segmentation that combines object detection with semantic segmentation to identify and segment individual object instances.

sections.title: Advanced Segmentation Techniques
sections.content: Learn about recent advances like Mask R-CNN, panoptic segmentation, and transformer-based segmentation methods.

keyPoints: Working with segmentation masks and annotations
content.practicalExercise: Build a semantic segmentation model for autonomous driving scenarios using cityscapes dataset.

prerequisites: Understanding of linear algebra and calculus
learningOutcomes: Deploy computer vision models in production
Understand modern CNN architectures and their applications
